definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: I"ll get after them to work three shifts to step up production."
sentences.chinese: 我会督促工厂采用三班倒的形式来增加生产。

sentences.english: They work round-the-clock in three shifts.
sentences.chinese: 工作采取三班倒连续作业。

sentences.english: The workers work in three shifts around the clock.
sentences.chinese: 这些工人们的工作是三班倒的，日夜不停。

sentences.english: Our factory operates round the clock on three shifts.
I 'd like to work in three shifts.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢上三班倒的工作。

sentences.english: Mom and Dad have to work in a hospital, working three shifts, is not fixed.
sentences.chinese: 爸妈都在医院里工作，工作三班倒，不固定。

definition: to change shifts/to work in turns

pinyin: ba1 xiao3 shi2 gong1 zuo4 zhi4

definition: to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
piece rate wage/remuneration based on one's output/opposite: time rate wage 計時工資|计时工资[ji4 shi2 gong1 zi1]
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
